text: I'm really excited to be cooking today
from our latest cookbook one pot it's
from the editors of Martha Stewart
Living it's a hundred and twenty recipes
that just use one pot so dinner is a
cinch to get on the table I'm going to
be making the kimchi stew with chicken
and tofu from the book it's super tasty
let's get started so in my large 1 pot
I'm adding 3 and 1/4 cup low-sodium
chicken stock 2 and a half cups water go
ahead and get this turned on to that I'm
gonna add delicious aromatics we're
adding 1 tablespoon of chopped garlic 2
teaspoons finely minced fresh ginger and
1 teaspoon minced anchovy fillet now
this is a great way to get your omega-3
fatty acids adds a really nice savory
punch to anything you're cooking a huge
fan of the little fish now to this I'm
adding two chicken thighs but I'm giving
the bone in so that the chicken cooks
and is nice and moist and flavorful so
bring this mixture to a boil then reduce
it to a simmer and let it cook simmering
for about 15 minutes until the chicken
is cooked all the way through so my
chicken cooked for about 15 minutes and
I took it out so that it would cool you
don't want to shred it up while it's
burning hot you'll burn your fingers but
now it's ready to shred now one of the
reasons I love cooking chicken with the
bone-in is that it helps keep the meat
nice and tender it also adds a really
nice depth of flavor so my chickens
shredded ready to return to the pot now
to this I'm going to add our kimchi this
is 2 16 ounce jars of kimchi kimchi is
traditionally used as a condiment it's
Korean fermented dish made with napa
cabbage really really great for
digestion it helps to promote a healthy
immune system it's also going to add a
tremendous amount of spice which is what
I love about this stew so I drained the
cans and I do reserve about 1/2 a cup of
the liquid I'm going to add that to my
stew as well
so let's give this a stir I just want to
keep the heat at a very gentle simmer to
heat the kimchi through now for my last
ingredient I'm going to add silken tofu
and I love using silken tofu because it
has such a nice tender consistency you
want to be really gentle with this so
I'm just gonna spoon portions into the
bowl don't want to agitate it too much
because these larger pieces are so
lovely try to keep them whole this is
one pound of silken tofu so it's great
smells wonderful already I'm just gonna
turn up the heat a bit you don't want to
stir it too much because again we want
to keep those pieces of silken tofu
large if possible so I'm gonna let the
tofu just warm up a bit slice up some
scallions for garnish already smelling
great looks like it's simmering very
gently so kimchi is pretty rich in
sodium so definitely taste before you
season to see if you need additional
salt I'm just gonna add a pinch here and
we should be good to go let's try this
smells delicious beautiful broth lots of
cabbage here
sprinkle with some fresh scallions for
crunch this looks delicious
mmm oh that is good and spicy I can't
wait for you to try this and all the
other delicious recipes and our new
one-pot book
hi and thanks for watching if you'd like
to see more eat clean videos we've got
